alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Franklin; Lamoille; Orleans; Washington; Western Addison; Western Chittenden; Western Franklin (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 9:34PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Snow showers, heavy at times across parts of Vermont... Areas of snow showers continue to move across northern and central Vermont, and will die down overnight. Snow will be heavy at times, and a quick accumulation of 1 to 3 inches is possible. Affected locations will see rapidly changing weather and road conditions with brief heavy snow and gusty winds. Visibilities below 1 mile are expected and possibly below a half mile in rare instances. Snow is currently falling heavily in Bolton, Richmond, Jonesville and Huntington. This area of heavy snow is slowly tracking eastward towards Waterbury, Duxbury, Fayston and Moretown. Precautionary/Preparedness Actions... Be prepared for areas of blowing and drifting snow. This could lead to temporary whiteout conditions and the potential for dangerous driving conditions. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
